intro: Guenthera persica subsp. takhtajanii, commonly known as the Persian guenthera, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Iran. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound umbels and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Its flowers are small and white, often arranged in compact clusters, while its leaves are finely divided and lanceolate in shape. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
